byline.original: By TODD SELBY and ABBY AGUIRRE

abstract: Two sisters turn pie baking into a booming business in industrial Brooklyn.
snippet: Two sisters turn pie baking into a booming business in industrial Brooklyn.
lead_paragraph: Melissa and Emily Elsen, two sisters from South Dakota, opened Four & Twenty Blackbirds, their pie and coffee shop in the Gowanus section of Brooklyn, with the expectation that they would serve about 10 pies a day. A little over a year later, they are averaging more like 50 pies a day, with customers traveling from around New York City to sample their fresh, seasonal fillings, like blueberry rhubarb or strawberry balsamic. Though they are doing a brisk business, the sisters Elsen continue to make their crust from scratch, two pounds at a time. "We love the homespun, hands-on intensity of it," Emily says. "When you make a good pie crust, it's really gratifying." Go to interactive feature >>
